snippet: Jack Dorsey, a co-founder of Twitter, is now working on Square, a mobile payment system. He believes the clear glass and open spaces of the office will build the trust and transparency the company must cultivate to succeed.
abstract: Jack Dorsey, a co-founder of Twitter, is now working on Square, a mobile payment system. He believes the clear glass and open spaces of the office will build the trust and transparency the company must cultivate to succeed.

snippet: The headquarters of the start-up Square would be the absolute worst place to play hide-and-seek. There are no offices. Executives sit in open cubicles. All of the conference rooms, large and small, are surrounded by walls of clear glass. The only ...
abstract: Nick Bilton Disruptions column notes Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey is now working on Square, a mobile payment system; says Dorsey believes the clear glass and open spaces of his San Francisco office will build the trust and transparency the company must cultivate to succeed. (M)

snippet: The new Nokia Lumia 900 sure is pretty.     Yes, that's right, I just publicly lusted after a non-Apple smartphone. A phone that runs Microsoft's Windows Phone 7 operating system, no less.
abstract: Bits blog features interview with Nokia chief executive Stephen A Elop, who discusses firm's new Lumia 900 Windows phone. Photo (M)
